sentences.en: Giving them an airy wave of his hand, the Commander sailed past.
sentences.cn: 这位海军中校随意地朝他们挥挥手便扬帆而过。

sentences.en: He is commander-in-chief in name only.
sentences.cn: 他只是名义上的总司令。

sentences.en: He personally had received orders from Commander Lehmann to scuttle the ship.
sentences.cn: 他个人已收到莱曼司令要求凿沉轮船的命令。

sentences.en: He was quite favourably impressed with the new French commander.
sentences.cn: 他对新的法国指挥官印象很好。

sentences.en: He was to be the commander-in-chief of the armed forces.
sentences.cn: 他将担任武装部队的最高统帅。

sentences.en: MacArthur was Supreme Commander for the allied powers in the Pacific.
sentences.cn: 麦克阿瑟将军曾是太平洋战区盟军的最高统帅。

sentences.en: Mobutu ascended through the ranks, eventually becoming commander of the army.
sentences.cn: 蒙博托出身行伍，通过一级级晋升，最终成为了陆军司令。
美军指挥官奥蒂斯将军

sentences.en: The commander and some of the men had been released.
sentences.cn: 指挥官和一些士兵已经获释。

sentences.en: The commander had been forewarned of the attack.
sentences.cn: 指挥官预先得到敌人要发动袭击的警告。

sentences.en: the commander of the third army corps
sentences.cn: 陆军第三军团的指挥官

sentences.en: The commander said that the army would comply with the ceasefire.
sentences.cn: 指挥官说军队会遵守停火协议。

sentences.en: The commander waved to the soldiers to march on.
the Supreme Commander of the armed forces

words.tran_cn: 指挥的；居高临下的；威风凛凛的
司令官，指挥官；军事学校的校长

phrases.tran_cn: 最高指挥官；最高统帅；最高司令官

trans.tran_en: an officer of any rank who is in charge of a group of soldiers or a particular military activity
